fields.description:
From me:
When I first login to Jira, the "Fix For" field does not appear in the Quick Search form.

From Jira support:
Since "Fix For" values are different among projects, it is designed to be not shown initially.

From me:
The problem is that I have "Fix For" values that are the same among multiple projects.  I want to do one query that will allow me to see all issues for all of these projects for a particular "Fix For" value, but currently I can't do that.  Currently I would need to do one interactive query per project or create an advanced query.  In comparison, Bugzilla allows me to do an interactive multi-project "Target Milestone" query.
fields.summary: cannot Quick Search for a single "Fix For" value across multiple projects

fields.description: If I am in a project browsing page (e.g., /browse/*projectname*#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Asummary-panel) and realize I need to change project settings, I have to click several times before I get to the admin page. Why not provide a direct link to the admin page or at least a *Tools* menu with a project admin link?

fields.description:
JIRA contains a number of support related JSPs that have been added over the years.  They were mostly for fighting spam and other support related tasks.  Unfortunately none of these were ever tested very much and contain a lot of XSS holes.  They are:
* groupnames.jsp
* indexbrowser.jsp
* classpath-debug.jsp
* viewdocument.jsp
* cleancommentspam.jsp
* plugin-bundles.jsp

They should all be removed from JIRA unless we make a concentrated effort on integrating the functionality that they provide into the product!
fields.summary: Miscellaneous support-related JSPs contain XSS holes

fields.description: The announcement preview banner is currently displayed via the global decorator.  It can be used for an XSS attack on virtually every page, via the announcement_preview_banner_st URL parameter.  We should display the preview only locally in the admin section.
fields.summary: Announcement Preview banner is a vector for an XSS attack

With the new issue detail view coming with JIRA 4.1 we have real trouble because every existing custom field of the types
* user picker
* multi user picker
* group picker
* multi group picker

is now displayed on the right column under "*People*" regardless the screen tab definition!

Since we are heavily using these kinds of custom fields for different purposes (especially for dynamic right management) we hide these fields in different screen tabs in order to not disturb the user with unnecessary pieces of information.

*My improvement proposal would be that these custom fields should be displayed in the screen tabs as defined in the screen schemes.*

And to be honest, I'm very unhappy with this new behaviour. In my point of view every custom field independent of its type has to be displayed furthermore together with the other custom field values! Or this should be adjustable!

fields.description:
Root cause issue is tracked against the responsible component: https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1292

When running JIRA 4.1 in the environment described above, the dashboard displays but the dashboard gadgets all appear blank.

Further investigation shows that the browser is receiving a 404 Not Found response for a request to this URL:

https://proxy_server/jira/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/js/auth-refresh.js?v=5416e5c818122a4e1d32842a7aa9bd&container=atlassian&debug=0

This cannot be found as it is passed through as http://jire_server:8080/jira' is an invalid path on the server.  All other requests made by the page are to either '/jira' or '/' which can be resolved fine.

As the page cannot get hold of auth-refresh.js this causes JavaScript errors and the dashboard gadgets do not display anything.

We were using this exact configuration with JIRA 4.0.2 and had no problems with the dashboard gadgets going via the proxy server.
fields.summary: Gadgets don't display through proxy server

fields.description:
*Symptoms*
The page contains elements that are being rendered incorrectly. In this example, the second select list is too wide: !rendering.png|border=1!

*Cause*
Some web pages may be incompatible with the new engines in IE7 and IE8.

*Workaround*
Usually, IE is capable to figure out when a page is not compatible with its new rendering engine and automatically enable "Compatibility Mode" for that page. When that doesn't happen, [enable Compatibility Mode manually|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/956197].

*Suggested Solution*
Make JIRA fully compatible with IE7 and IE8 changing HTML, CSS and so on.
fields.summary: Issue type select renders incorrectly in IE7 and IE8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20999].
  {panel}

New feature request.

In light of the recent security hack at Apache, it might be prudent for JIRA to provide some more secure options for user authentication.

One candidate is two-factor authentication using the [RFC 4226 (OATH/HOTP)|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HOTP] standard. This requires the user to have a token that will generate the one-time passwords. However, several software tokens now run on cell phones, so this is less of a burden these days. This also requires an ability to configure JIRA with the token's secret hex key, which amounts to adding a new field in the edit user page.

Instead of using only their password to login, the user would enter their password followed by the one-time password generated by the token. The JIRA authentication code would compute the same one-time password to verify. The algorithm is simple and open source versions exist.

Examples of software out there using the OATH algorithm (these happen to be written by me):
* [OATH Token|http://oathtoken.googlecode.com/] for iPhone
* [mod_authn_otp|http://mod-authn-otp.googlecode.com/] Apache authentication module.
fields.summary: Allow user accounts to require two-factor authentication using RFC 4226

fields.description:
{panel:borderColor=#ff0000|borderStyle=solid|bgColor=#ffcccc}*Note*: This issue is superceded by JRA-21004. Please install the patches on that issue, rather than this one.

For more details, see *[JIRA Security Advisory - 2010-04-16|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2010-04-16]*.

The security advisory also has details of [how to determine if your JIRA installation has been compromised|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Security+Addendum+2010-04-16+-+Determining+if+your+public+JIRA+instance+has+been+compromised] and another addendum on [good system administration practices to protect your public JIRA installation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Security+Addendum+2010-04-16+-+Preventing+security+attacks]. These additions are valuable even if you cannot apply the patch immediately.

_If you have already installed this patch, install JRA-21004 on top of this patch._{panel}

We have identified and fixed a privilege escalation vulnerability, which may affect JIRA instances.

This vulnerability is only applicable when an attacker has gained administration access on the instance.  An attacker, who has gained administrator access to a JIRA instance could set the attachment, index, or backup paths to a location within the JIRA web application directory. Once this has been done, the attacker can upload malicious code that can execute in the context of the user running the application server in which JIRA is deployed. The attacker could potentially modify JIRA's files and capture user credentials. If you have followed standard guidelines for hardening your application servers, then your instance should be less susceptible to this vulnerability.

*We recommend that you apply the attached patch immediately to address these vulnerabilities.*
The Instructions to apply the patch is contained within the Readme file as part of the attached zip. Please download the appropriate patch for your version of JIRA (these patches have only been tested on the point releases specified in the zip filename). If you are not on the point release that the patch is created for, it is recommended that you first upgrade to the latest point release for your version of JIRA before applying the patch.

If you are applying this patch, we also recommend you apply the patch for JRA-20994.


*Further Updates*
This vulnerability occurs if you have configured your attachment directory, index directory, or backup directory to locations on the filesystem such that the contents can be served by the JIRA's Tomcat (or any other) application server. For example, assume that you have a J2EE/Java Webpp being served from /opt/application. You will be vulnerable to this attack if you set the attachment, index or backup directories to:
* the webapp location - /opt/application
* any path within the webapp location e.g. /opt/application/attachments or /opt/application/a/b/attachments
* any path above the webapp location e.g. / or /opt

Please note that you should consider all web applications you have on the server. For example, if you have one application served from /opt/application, and another served from /usr/local/application, then the attachment, index and backup directories should not be set to any of: /, /opt, /opt/application and its descendents, /usr, /usr/local, /usr/local/application and its descendents.

This also affects standalone installations. For example, if you have installed JIRA 4.1 standalone at: C:\apps\jira. By default, the webapp location of jira is at C:\apps\jira\atlassian-jira. Attachment, Index and backup directories should not be set to C:\, C:\apps, C:\apps\jira, C:\apps\jira\atlassian-jira, or further descendents. However, C:\apps\jira\attachments is fine.

We strongly recommend that you check these directories in JIRA, and if you currently have attachment, backup or index directories which are vulnerable as described above, that you move those directories to locations which are un-related to your webapp locations. Please note that you will need to follow these instructions even if you have applied the attached patches.
fields.summary: Privilege escalation vulnerability when administrator access is compromised

fields.description:
{panel:borderColor=#ff0000|borderStyle=solid|bgColor=#ffcccc}*Warning*: This issue is superceded by JRA-21004. Please install the patches on that issue, rather than this one.

For more details, see *[JIRA Security Advisory - 2010-04-16|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2010-04-16]*.

The security advisory also has details of [how to determine if your JIRA installation has been compromised|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Security+Addendum+2010-04-16+-+Determining+if+your+public+JIRA+instance+has+been+compromised] and another addendum on [good system administration practices to protect your public JIRA installation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Security+Addendum+2010-04-16+-+Preventing+security+attacks]. These additions are valuable even if you cannot apply the patch immediately.

_If you have already installed this patch, install JRA-21004 on top of this patch._{panel}

We have identified vulnerabilities in JIRA which will allow an attacker to invoke XSS (Cross Site Scripting) attacks in JIRA.  Some attacks possible with these vulnerabilities include:
    *  An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to steal other users' session cookies or other credentials, by sending the credentials back to the attacker's own web server.
    * An attacker's text and script might be displayed to other people viewing the JIRA page.

You can read more about XSS attacks at [cgisecurity|http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml], [CERT|http://www.cert.org/advisories/CA-2000-02.html] and other places on the web.

*We recommend that you apply the attached patch immediately to address these vulnerabilities.* 
The Instructions to apply the patch is contained within the Readme file as part of the attached zip. Please download the appropriate patch for your version of JIRA (these patches have only been tested on the point releases specified in the zip filename). If you are not on the point release that the patch is created for, it is recommended that you first upgrade to the latest point release for your version of JIRA before applying the patch. 

Alternatively, if you are not in a position to undertake this immediately and you judge it necessary, you could disable public access to JIRA (for example, by removing appropriate [global|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions] or [project-specific|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Permissions] 'Anyone' permissions) and change JIRA's mode to disable [public signup|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options]) until you have either applied the necessary patches. For even tighter control, you could restrict access to trusted [groups|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Groups].

If you are applying this patch, we also recommend you apply the patch for JRA-20995.
fields.summary: XSS Vulnerabilities in JIRA

fields.description:
Time Tracking Field Accepts more than one entry unqualified by a time unit (i.e. 1w 2w) and therefore, potentially accepting incorrect input.

For example let's say a user has meant to input 5 hours and 30 minutes as his original estimate and that the default time unit for JIRA is hours, then the user makes a mistake and really inputs 5 30 (instead of 5 30m). JIRA will accept this wrong value and will add things up so that the original estimate gets set to 35h.

This really should be flagged as an input error. Might be related and fixed by tackling JRA-20974.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Field Accepts more than one entry unqualified by a time unit

fields.description:
Time Tracking Field Accepts more than one entry qualified by the same time unit (i.e. 1w 2w) and therefore, potentially accepting incorrect input.

For example let's say a user has meant to input 1w 2d as his original estimate, but makes a mistakes and really inputs 1w 2w. JIRA will accept this wrong value and will add things up so that the original estimate gets set to 3w.

This really should be flagged as an input error.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Field Accepts more than one entry qualified by the same time unit

fields.description:
A config changed happened between Tomcat 5.5 and 6 ( JIRA 4.0 uses 5.5, JIRA 4.1 uses 6 ). Now one must put SSLEnabled="True" in the Connector which is not present in JIRA's server.xml for 4.1:
{noformat}
<Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" 
              maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75" 
              enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true" 
              acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true" 
              clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"/>
{noformat}

should be

{noformat}
<Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true" 
              maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75" 
              enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true" 
              acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true" 
              clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"/>
{noformat}

Will update the 4.1 documentation in the meantime
fields.summary: SSL connector in server.xml incorrect for JIRA 4.1 Standalone

fields.description:
As in all companies people come and go, but Jira can not handle this correctly. 

With leaving the company the peoples are deleted from our Windows-ActiveDirectory. 

When doing so and the person has created tickets or is current assignee the tickets can be opened but you can not change the owner or assigne or close the issues. At present we do recreate a "dummy-account" with the former username of the deleted account in crowd to be able to shift the tickets to an other person. 


Further more:
- you can not search for "deleted" accounts
- deleted accounts can not be deleted from the projekt roles as they are not listed in the edit view


A well working solution is very much appreciated.
Best
Andreas


See the error message below while trying to close or editing a ticket from a deleted person.

fields.description:
We have an issue type with two tabs (General, Reopen).

The field "Reference" should be on the General tab, the fields "Last Assigned Date" and "Reopening Counter" on the Reopen tab.

When this issue is opened, the General tab is selected and we see all 3 fields on the screen (one from the General tab, and the two from the Reopen tab). See "Issue first opened.jpg"

Then select the Reopen tab: We only see the the two fields of this tab. That's OK, see "Issue Reopen Tab.jpg" 

Then back to the General tab: We only see only one field. That's OK, see "Issue back to genral tab.jpg",

So, the Issue shows only the wrong fields when opened first.
fields.summary: Issue View shows fields of second tab when first opened

fields.description:
The "Create New User" page has a checkbox called "Send Password Email" with the following description:
{quote}
Send an email to the user you have just created containing their password.
Uncheck this option if you are using a LDAP server. 
{quote}
However, this is not really correct.
The password is not sent, but rather a link to let the user change their own password.
The email actually looks like this:
{noformat}
A JIRA account has been created for you at:

   http://somewhere/jira

This is either because an administrator has created an account for you,
or because you have been assigned to an issue.

If you follow the link below you will be able to personally set your own password.

  http://somewhere/jira/secure/ResetPassword!default.jspa?os_username=dude&token=BBD0337346443C54E58C3B22F62A2430

This password set request is valid for the next 24 hours.  Don't worry you can always ask for a new password using the following link.

  http://somewhere/jira/secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa?username=dude


Here are the details of your account:
---------------------------------------------------------------------
            Username: dude
               Email: dude@atlassian.com
           Full Name: Dude McDoodle


This action was initiated by Administrator (admin@example.com).
{noformat}

fields.description:
Currently JIRA seems to allow an administrator to create a User with a blank password.
However, that user is not able to log in with the blank password.
Furthermore, if you attempt to change the password on an existing user, there is validation that does not allow a blank password to be entered.

This leads me to believe that the Add User page should also validate against blank passwords
fields.summary: The Add User page allows users with blank passwords, but the user cannot log in.

fields.description:
1) Set up two Atlassian apps (I used JIRA 4.1 final and Confluence 3.2 final).
2) Add Confluence as an OAuth Consumer to JIRA.
3) Add the JIRA Activity Stream gadget to the External Gadget list in Confluence.
4) Insert the gadget onto a Confluence page and view it using IE.

The following behaviour occurs...

* Before authentication:
** IE6/IE7 - the activity stream shows "No activity was found", even if anonymous access is enabled. 
** FireFox/IE8/Safari - the activity entries are displayed as expected.
* After authentication...
** IE6/IE7 - a JavaScript error is thrown - "'null' is null or not an object" and the activity stream gadget is blank, except for the cog icon.
** IE8 - the activity stream shows "No activity was found".
** FireFox/Safari - the activity entries are displayed as expected.

Or for a visual summary, please see the attached screenshot collection.
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream gadget is broken when accessed externally using IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20939].
  {panel}

In order to comply with Sarbanes-Oxley audit requirements my Operations team requires that we trace changes at the jira project level, not merely at the issue level.

While jira logs change management on each issue (i.e., issue is closed, assigned, etc), my operations team has not identified a way to log and track changes at the project level (i.e., permission schemes, notification schemes, account creation, etc.).

I understand that this feature does not exist in jira, thus I'm requesting it in order to provide a full audit trail of all action within Jira.

William
fields.summary: trace log for change management of changes to projects, not issues

fields.description:
In the user guide 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-HandlerParameters

it suggests creating an account to be the reporter for email submissions, when you don't want to create an account for users who submit via email.

This seems unnecessary and wastes a user license.

Also if you setup the reporter to be the project lead, the lead won't be notified that there is a new issue if they have the personal settings set to not send them email on changes they make themselves.
fields.summary: Wasted User License for Email as Reporter

fields.description:
*deep breath*

Basically I set myself up to be forwarded an email whenever a mail service receives an email. While testing I was sending emails to JIRA and I wasn't getting anything forward to me because (I'm assuming) my email account was the same email account that was setup to be forwarded to and I had the don't send me emails check box checked in my personal settings.

This may not be an isssue, but it's something I wish I had known about.
fields.summary: Mail Service Doesn't Send Error Message

fields.description:
+Use Case:+
Remove or _hide_ a Select List option from being displayed so that it is not selectable by a user when an issue is created. This is in contrast to deleting the option from the Select List. 

+Business Case:+
There is presently no way to _prevent an option in a Select List from being selected_ when an issue is being created other than to delete the option from the Select List.

Yet _deleting an option also removes all matching values from existing issues_. in many cases this is _not desirable_ and, in fact, results in a loss of important information.

Hiding an option would retain all matching values for existing issues but would not allow it to be selected for new issues. The hidden option could be either grayed out in the list or not displayed in the list.

+Example:+
In the attached image a Select List is show along with Hide and Show operations. In this example, when creating an issue the user would only see items 1,2,3, & 5. They would not see item 4. Yet item 4 would still be displayed in all previously created issues for which it was selected.
fields.summary: Custom fields of type "select list" need the ability to hide/show options displayed in the list
Add information about debugging plugins

fields.description:
In a very rare scenario, the ops bar can get mixed up with the page content in Safari and mess up the page layout.

The scenario is the combination of the following:
1) Safari (4.0.4 or 4.0.5) on Mac (not Windows),
2) Following a permlink to a comment,
3) Opening the link in a new tab and not switching to that tab until after it has finished loading.

If all of these are true, the page looks like the following:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100408-ep4wtrba2rdpja7tuicimhxakr.png!

(URL for this is http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TST-20973?focusedCommentId=191026&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_191026 )

Any action - such as scrolling, switching to another window and back - will fix it.

fields.description: I'd like to be able to assign bugs to tasks, so that we can see how many "bugs" were fixed compared to "features added".  If there is no issue type associated with a sub task then we can't do that.  Features and bugs will look the same.
fields.summary: Keep Issue Type when converted to a Sub Task

fields.description:
Hi!

* There is a significant changes in the JIRA directory. Please refer to the Screenshots attached. For example, the <JIRA_Install>/common/lib is no longer available in JIRA 4.1 standalone.

* Beside, there is no need for JIRA standalone to copy the JDBC/Connector to the <JIRA_Install>/lib since the JDBC connector for MySQL, PostgreSQL(jdbc3) and Oracle since the JDBC connector is shipped with JIRA 4.1 standalone.

Hope you can review the documentation for Connecting JIRA to databases (especially MySQL):
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL

My concern is, the users that tried to install JIRA 4.1 will raise a lot of installation query due to confusion if this documentation is not updated. 

Cheers,
Janet
fields.summary: JIRA 4.1 installation documentation (standalone)-3. Copy the MySQL driver to your application server

The numbers itself in the portlet are OK (e.g. 6) but when klciking on the '6' lead to a result of 30 items in the navigator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20916].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a shared filter having similar JQL:
{code}
project in (PROJECT1, PROJECT2) ORDER BY created DESC
{code}

2. Login as a user having only browse permission for "PROJECT2".
3. View the filter in issue navigator.
4. It shows user the number of issues allowed to see. Add a "filter results" gadget on the dashboard.
5. Select the filter.

h3. Result:
The user gets error message "The selected filter filter-<ID> has an error: A value with ID '<ID>' does not exist for the field 'project'..

h3. Expected:
Here also user should be able to view issues from project having browse permission.

h3. Notes

Attempting to access the XML view of a filter with this configuration will result in a HTTP 400 with an error similar to "HTTP Status 400 - A value with ID '10000' does not exist for the field 'project'." as per the attached image.
fields.summary: Shared filter queries don't work with "Filter Result" gadget if login user doesn't have browse permission on one of the projects.

fields.description:
Early usability feedback, coupled with Penny's identification of the "Left/Right | Previous/Next mapping leaving a little to be desired", gives us an opportunity to fix the pagination control for 

1. better understandability of "return to search" (Edwin)
2. a non-jumping affordance (Veenu)
3. a larger mousetarget (Jay)
4. a better natural mapping to J/K up and down progression through the issue list (Penny)


Edwin suggested we move the arrows to UP/DOWN rather than left right, which perfectly solves this problem.  We'll add an explicit "back to search" link as well.
fields.summary: the "next issue arrow" on view issue sits in the spot of the prev issue arrow

Expectation:

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Press C to open "Create Issue" dialog.
3. Press Ctrl+Alt+<any shortcut> to access any of the header drop down menus.

Result:
1. User has both "Create Issue" and "Header menu " drop down open.
2. If user try to access header menu using mouse key..no issues.

Expected:
1. The "Create Issue" dialog should get close.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut: "Create Issue" dialog doesn't get close when user try to access header drop down options using shortcuts in safari.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Press C, user gets a "Create issue" dialog. Default focus is on "Create".
3. Try tabbing through the fields.

Result:
1. Its very frustrating for user if he/she wants to change project/issue type through keyboard as tabbing move the focus to everywhere in page except coming back to "project"/"issue type".

Expected:
1. The tab should move the focus only between the fields of open dialog.
2. The fix will be a usability win.
fields.summary: keyboard navigation tab order is mixed up in "create issue" mini dialog.

fields.description:
Since we build the source 3 times - we run the integration tests 3 times. Only the unit tests should be run during this process. Expecting it to be only run during the run_soap_func_tests.

JRADEV-1041 makes it worse (ie we're running it 3 x 2 = 6 times more often than required).
fields.summary: Nightly build runs rpc plugin integration tests during the build process
